title: A Guide to Mexican Art-From Its Beginnings to the Present
description:
A Guide to Mexican Art: From Its Beginnings to the Present
University of Chicago Press | 1969 | ISBN 0226244210 | Eng | 424 pag | PDF | 70.6 MB

A Guide to Mexican Art, a survey of more than twenty centuries of art, has a double purpose. It provides an ample version of one of the great national arts by a leading art historian, and it serves simultaneously as a practical guide to the art's outstanding masterpieces. The Guide will thus be of value to specialists and students of Latin American art and to sightseers as an introduction and guide to the art and architecture of Mexico. To facilitate its use for the latter purpose, Professor FernÃ¡ndez has based his exposition on the sensitive analysis of works to be found almost exclusive in museums and public buildings accessible to the tourist
